intro: Gutenbergia nigritiana, commonly known as the black nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its small, bell-shaped flowers are usually purple or violet, and it produces berries that turn from green to black when mature. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to both humans and animals.
